artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Enshūya Hikobei; Carver: Katada Chōjirō
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 83; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), p. 13 no. 12, p. 299.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: unattached triptych: three female figures in colorful clothing standing on a bridge over bay with buildings in background; woman at L wears green coat over blue kimono, and is facing R; C woman in black kimono with gray flowers, red skirts; R figure has purple and yellow kimono with green crane motif
dimension: 14 × 28 1/2 in. (35.56 × 72.39 cm) (image, sheet, assembled, vertical ōban triptych)
markings: Carver’s seal: 深彫長 {Fuka hori Chō} | Censor seal: 戌四改
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
signed: 一魁斎芳年画 {Ikkaisai Yoshitoshi ga}
title: Triptych Parodying the Great City
